revised_title: Investigations in the Infra-Red Region of the Spectrum: The Absorption Spectrum of Carbon Disulphide
tldr: The authors investigated the absorption spectrum of carbon disulphide in the infra-red region using a more advanced apparatus than previous studies. They found that carbon disulphide is a rectilinear molecule with no permanent electric moment. The study also discusses the molecular structure, vibration-rotation bands, and the origin of the doublet structure in the spectrum.
